entry.title: Welcome back, dog lovers: Roseburg's Happy Tails Dog Park to reopen after flood damages
entry.summary: Littered with debris, covered in sand and altogether ruined, Roseburg’s Happy Tails Dog Park was just one of many locations heavily damaged by widespread flooding on March 16.

entry.title: Cowboys and comforters: Roseburg businesses to close brick and mortar storefronts
entry.summary: In need of a brand new pair of cowboy boots, a mattress to match a bed frame or both? Now’s the time to shop as two locally-owned Roseburg businesses are closing down their physical storefronts.

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOR WARRANT
entry.summary: July 25, 2025 3:40 p.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man for a warrant on Thursday. An RPD report said just after 4:20 p.m. officers arrested the 58-year-old on a failure to appear warrant out of Coos County. The man was detained on $10,000 bail and was released on Friday.

entry.title: Major Disaster Declaration releases funds for Douglas, nearby counties

entry.title: The indomitable Sister Jeanita
entry.summary: The Roseburg community has lost a visionary and tireless advocate for the education and well-being of its children. Sister Jeanita Richter passed away peacefully on July 11 in Roseburg in the presence of family and her long-time friend.
